alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:37AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Orange, northeastern Rutland and northern Windsor Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 137 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Killington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Woodstock, Barnard, Tunbridge, Sharon, Killington, Bethel, Stockbridge, Pomfret, Norwich, Mendon, Pittsfield, Royalton, Chittenden, Bridgewater, Strafford, Hartford, Chelsea, Randolph, and Pittsford. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 6 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
